ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Chem 547 explains EPR from a quantum mechanical perspective. It is a deeper look into EPR than one gets in the other survey courses and is focused on mathematical understanding rather than spectral interpretation. I would recommend this course to student who already had some interest in paramagnetic systems, as the course is very specific.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course greatly enhanced my knowledge of EPR and quantum mechanics. Before taking this course, I could interpret the basic structure of a spectrum, but now I have the tools to understand more subtle spectral differences which relate to electronic structure. This course will be very helpful to my dissertation research, which includes some EPR spectroscopy.
I appreciated how the course applied seemingly esoteric concepts I had learned in Molecules and Radiation.
